intro: Pseudognaphalium chrysocephalum, commonly known as goldenhead cudweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its bright yellow flower heads are composed of many tiny florets, and it produces small, fluffy seeds that are dispersed by the wind. It is often found in arid or semi-arid regions and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
